entry.title: Effortless SAPUI5 Patch Management: Introducing the New SAPUI5 Runtime Repository
entry.content:
For years, the MIME repository has been the standard location for storing SAPUI5 runtime artifacts for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. In contrast, the S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition retrieves SAPUI5 from the cloud CDN. Although the MIME repository has served its purpose, many customers working with SAPUI5, especially system operators installing new SAPUI5 patches, face common challenges. These include poor performance, numerous manual steps, issues with transports, and risk of inconsistent states.

The good news is that SAP introduces the SAPUI5 Runtime Repository with the release of SAP S/4HANA 2025. This modern replacement overcomes these challenges and prepares you for the next generation of SAPUI5. To ensure efficiency for all customers, downports to all maintained lower releases are available, except for SAP S/4HANA 1809 using SAPUI5 1.38. You can access this repository through SAP Notes containing transport-based correction instructions (TCIs).

Let's explore how this new repository significantly enhances your workflow.

Performance Where It Matters

  • MIME Repository: SAPUI5 patch updates can take up to 2 hours. Loading debug-sources with sap-ui-debug=true can take up to 10 minutes.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Patch upgrades are approximately 20 times faster. During runtime, loading debug sources also occurs about 20 times faster. These improvements ensure smoother operations and faster response times.

From Complexity to Simplicity

  • MIME Repository: Handles more than 70,000 individual ABAP objects. This volume poses a risk of errors and inconsistent updates.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: All runtime content is bundled into just one ABAP object. This approach guarantees consistent updates and reduces operational risks.

Automation First

  • MIME Repository: Updates rely on custom, manual procedures, which increases the maintenance effort.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Uses SAP TCI Notes and comes with an automated process specifically for SAP S/4HANA cloud operations. This makes updates easier and more reliable.

Zero Downtime Deployments

  • MIME Repository: No support for zero-downtime deployments. This limitation might cause interruptions during system upgrades.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Fully supports online deployment with zero downtime. This feature ensures that SAPUI5 content remains continuously available, even during system upgrades.

Safe, Standardized Rollbacks

  • MIME Repository: Reverting patches can be error-prone, often requiring manual fixes and risking inconsistent system states.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Reverting SAPUI5 patches is fully supported. Runtime content is delivered as a single ABAP object, and the update process integrates with TCIs. Rollbacks are straightforward, consistent, and safe. This approach simplifies the validation of new patches: if issues arise, you can reliably revert to the previous stable state without lengthy manual intervention or risking inconsistencies across systems.

Future-Proof 

  • MIME Repository: Not compatible with multiple SAPUI5 versions.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Supports multiple SAPUI5 versions in parallel, making it ready for the future while ensuring backward compatibility.

Here's an overview of all the improvements:

Why This Matters

The move from MIME Repository to the new SAPUI5 Runtime Repository isn’t just a technical upgrade — it’s a significant step toward:

  • Faster and safer patch updates.
  • Reduced operational effort.
  • Continuous availability.
  • Future compatibility.

If your organization uses on-premise landscapes and works with SAPUI5, it's time to embrace this change: the SAPUI5 Runtime Repository becomes automatically available with the current SAP S/4HANA 2025 release and in the latest support packages of all maintained SAP S/4HANA versions except SAP S/4HANA 1809.

Even if you do not want to upgrade to a new support package, you can still use the SAPUI5 runtime repository by installing SAP Note 3599156. If you have hesitated to install a new SAPUI5 patch, now is the time to try the new procedure and benefit from its efficacy and ease. Installing the latest SAPUI5 patches ensures your applications run efficiently today and are prepared for the future.

👉Have you performed any SAPUI5 patch upgrades recently? What has your experience been like so far? To get started, refer to SAP Note 3599156.

entry.title: SAP Screen Personas in the Default Installation Stack of SAP S/4HANA 2025, Private Cloud Edition
entry.content:
Implications for Greenfield Installations

For new SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition customers, this change ensures a simplified and accelerated setup experience.

With SAP Screen Personas pre-installed:

  • Customers gain immediate access to screen personalization and simplification capabilities.

  • The installation and configuration process is significantly simplified, reducing both time and effort.

This enhancement underscores SAP’s commitment to delivering a seamless and user-centric onboarding experience for S/4HANA customers.

Impact on Existing Installations

For existing SAP Screen Personas customers, the transition to SAP S/4HANA 2025 is expected to be smooth and non-disruptive.

  • If the currently installed SAP Screen Personas add-on version is compatible with SAP S/4HANA 2025, it can be retained and used without modification.

  • If the existing version is not compatible, a manual upgrade of the add-on must be completed prior to installing SAP S/4HANA 2025.

Future FPS Upgrades

When a new Feature Pack Stack (FPS) becomes available for SAP S/4HANA 2025, Private Cloud Edition, it will include the latest available Support Package (SP) of SAP Screen Personas at that time.

Support Package Release Strategy or SAP Screen Personas.

There is no change to the existing Support Package (SP) release strategy for SAP Screen Personas.

  • SAP will continue to deliver annual Support Package releases , providing regular enhancements and maintenance updates.
  • Customers may choose to upgrade to newer Support Packages as they become available.

This continuity ensures customers can plan their upgrades in alignment with their broader S/4HANA lifecycle strategy. Please refer to note 2013453 for more details.

Summary

With SAP Screen Personas now included as part of the default SAP S/4HANA 2025, Private Cloud Edition installation stack, customers benefit from an even more integrated and efficient user experience.

This change eliminates the need for separate installation steps and reinforces SAP’s ongoing focus on delivering streamlined, intuitive, and adaptable user experiences within the S/4HANA environment.

Further Reading:
  • SAP Screen Personas
  • Getting Started with UI Adaptations for Classic Applications in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Learn more about SAP Screen Personas:

  • Online training. The best way to learn the basics about SAP Screen Personas (Adapt UI for classic applications) is to take our free training course on the learning.sap.com platform: https://learning.sap.com/courses/adapting-the-ui-in-sap-s-4hana-cloud-using-sap-screen-personas
  • Connect with your peers. Every other month, we have a group of customers that gather online to share best practices, demo their flavors, and answer each other’s questions. Experts from the product team also join to explain how to use the latest functionality. If you are interested in joining, you can sign up online to join the SAP Screen Personas practitioner forum. This will add you to the mailing list for the monthly meeting summaries. Please contact “Peter Spielvogel“ or me directly if you want to join the monthly calls.
  • Product documentation. The SAP Screen Personas documentation, recently updated to be even more clear and comprehensive, contains the latest information about the product.

Going forward with SAP Screen Personas

If you are not currently using SAP Screen Personas, why not?

Worried that we won’t support it into the future? Don’t be.  We are supporting SAP Screen Personas functionality through at least 2040.

Have other concerns about the roadmap for SAP Screen Personas? See if we answer them in our latest roadmap blog post.

entry.title: ASUG Tech Connect 2025 summary: vibe coding, UX innovation, and AI everywhere
entry.content:
ASUG Tech Connect 2025 in Louisville, Kentucky, delivered big on both technology and connection. From the opening keynote to the final session, there were many examples of how AI improves both developer and business user productivity. While all the generative AI technologies are revolutionary and potentially very disruptive to organizations that ignore their impact, it was great to see AI applied in a variety of ways from creating ABAP code to moving Z-transactions in a clean core methodology. In this post, I’ll highlight a few important themes, along with several moments at ASUG Tech Connect that made an impact on me. In each section, I’ll provide some questions for you to discuss with your team.

ABAP is still going strong

The session “Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP” says it all. Jens and Raghavendra  showed that ABAP has new generative AI tools that you can use to extend standard SAP Fiori apps and build new custom apps. With so many customers still contemplating their journey to SAP S/4HANA Cloud, the ability to use familiar skills makes it easier to transition.

AI-powered features make SAP Cloud ERP even easier to use

In “What’s Next: AI-First Innovations in SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Business Suite”, Ullas and I showed several new embedded features to boost business users’ productivity, most of which were powered by AI. Demos included a mix of released functionality, features in beta, and even a sneak preview of something from our lab. We received lots of great feedback on how people plan to use smart helpers if we bring this to market.

My Home for SAP S/4HANA

SAP Fiori elements apps

  • AI-assisted enterprise search
  • AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for insights cards
  • AI-assisted smart solutions for situations in My Home
  • Recap
  • Joule
  • AI-assisted easy filter
  • AI-assisted smart summarization
  • AI-assisted easy fill
  • AI-assisted error explanation
  • Smart Helpers (working name – sneak preview)

Ask yourself:

  • Do your business users still spend too much time on manual navigation?
  • Could a smart home screen or conversational interface drastically reduce that?
  • What is holding you back from adopting AI in your organization?

No-code, low-code, and pro-code are converging with vibe coding

In “Using Generative AI to Accelerate SAP Fiori App Development” Ullas demonstrated how code-generation, conversational interfaces, and tooling changes are altering how we build apps. Using VS Code and Cline, connected to an SAP back end, he created a fully functional app, including CAP service and sample data, using only text prompts – no coding at all. He started the app creation process by loading an image of what he wanted, then added functionality by asking Cline to build it. When error messages came up, he pasted screen shots back into the tool and asked it to fix the error. This can reduce the time to create a first prototype from weeks to hours. Skilled developers are required for making sure the app is production worthy, testing, and putting into production. We had some customers share their experience using coding agents and appreciation for how SAP packaged this to simplify the process. Some plan to expand their efforts on this journey and potentially share their stories in next year’s ASUG Tech Connect or SAP TechEd.

Ask yourself:

  • How much more AI can you use to accelerate development?
  • What would you need to see to gain confidence that you can use it for building apps?
  • Can you rebuild some of your old customizations in a clean core way to make your IT environment more agile?

SAP Fiori is essential to capture the full value of your SAP Cloud ERP implementation

My session on “Creating better user experiences with AI-powered SAP Fiori apps” discussed how SAP Fiori is a critical part of generating value from using SAP S/4HANA. Most of the audience had some Fiori experience and most were using AI in some capacity in their organization.

 

The session started with the origins of Fiori and highlighted the huge leap in usability from the old SAP GUI screens to the intuitive, agile, and intelligent UX that My Home and SAP Fiori apps provide. It included a demo of many of the UX innovations in SAP Cloud ERP today, and discussion of how to get started with Fiori in your organization.

View slides from “Creating better user experiences with AI-powered SAP Fiori apps” session.

The main message was to get started now on your UX transformation to provide your employees with a better user experience and access to AI-assisted capabilities that are built int SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

Ask yourself:

  • What is holding us back from using more Fiori in the organization? Is it resistance from the users themselves, IT, or the business owners?
  • How do we quantify the business value of SAP Fiori in terms of higher user productivity, better data quality, lower training costs, and reduced cost of making changes to screens?

Clean core is necessary for digital transformation

The topic of clean core, meaning minimizing customizations to the SAP S/4HANA environment, was reinforced everywhere. The hands-on sessions “Build On-Stack Extensions with ABAP Cloud in SAP Cloud ERP” and “Modernize Classic Extensions for Clean Core” emphasized how you can use clean core principles and still build customizations to fit your business’s unique needs. Andre, Nora, and Ullas explained how to do this and guided people through practical exercises.

Ask yourself:

  • How much customization do you need to run your business? (Less is more!)
  • Can you use standard apps for more processes than you are doing today?
  • What is the cost of maintaining your custom code and how much is custom code preventing you from adopting the latest SAP ERP versions?

You don’t have to move to SAP Cloud ERP on your own

With such a broad collection of industries represented at ASUG Tech Connect, it was easy to find someone who had already solved the challenges you are facing. That’s the whole point of attending a large networking event like this – to connect with like-minded individuals who want to move forward and need a little help (or push). I was fortunate to have many interesting breakfast, lunch, and break conversations about where people are struggling with moving their users to SAP Fiori apps.

The colleagues from Naturipe Farms, Brian and Dario, shared some of their experiences in “Customer Show and Tell: From CDS View to Fiori Launchpad: Full-Stack Development with Eclipse ADT with Naturipe.” It was the third year in a row that they are presenting, so it’s great to follow their progress. Next year they plan to share their progress with a vibe-coding approach.

Ask yourself:

  • What communities can you join to learn from peers? ASUG, SAP Fiori development roundtable?
  • What thought leaders do you follow on LinkedIn that you can learn from?

There is no technology change without people change

It’s always the “soft skills” sessions that surprise me at SAP events with the lasting impact they make. Perhaps this is because the fundamental principles don’t change from year to year with new technology innovations, so they generally have more staying power. The panel on “Leading change in the age of AI: driving digital transformation through emotionally intelligent communication” had many great insights for business and technology leaders who are steering their organizations through the massive changes that an SAP S/4HANA upgrade, SAP Fiori implementation, or AI adoption brings. Some key takeaways included: focusing on business outcomes and ensuring that people can grow from the changes.

Ask yourself:

  • How can I empower my people by asking them: What are you good at? What do you want? What do you need? What do you fear? This will help you preempt many objections that are rooted in these issues.
  • What happens to my organization if we do nothing?

Get comfortable being uncomfortable

This is a time of rapid change for enterprise software and business in general. The AI tools have frequent updates in which their capabilities improve in some areas and don’t in others. It’s hard to keep up with all this, but critical. Nvidia CEO, Jensen Huang says “You’re not going to lose your job to AI. You’re going to lose your job to someone who uses AI.” Change is a part of progress; get used to it.

Ask yourself:

  • What new AI-related skills have you learned in the next month?
  • Where can you try some AI in your business that will allow you to learn with low risk?

Next steps:

  • Review the slides, which are available to attendees on the ASUG Tech Connect website.
  • Start exploring AI tools for development now. Even if you are not ready to incorporate them into your core business processes, you need to gain experience using them if you want to stay relevant in the industry.
  • Identify two use cases where AI can make a measurable business impact. Build a proof of concept in your test environment or sandbox system to measure the return on investment.
  • Follow the speakers of sessions that you liked on LinkedIn. You will gain insights into what they are working on and likely see innovations as soon as they become available.
  • Subscribe to our SAP Fiori development newsletter, where we will share new innovations for application development as soon as they are available.

entry.title: Discover what’s new in SAP Signavio’s major Process Landscape Analysis update this November
entry.content:
In today’s fast-paced ERP transformation landscape, achieving process transparency, harmonization, and efficiency is critical. Organizations migrating to SAP S/4HANA face the challenge of aligning complex business processes across multiple units while ensuring adoption of standardized templates. SAP Signavio’s Process Landscape Analysis (PLA), as part of the plug and gain approach, addresses these challenges by providing a structured, data-driven way to manage and optimize processes throughout the transformation journey. All essentials and key resources regarding plug and gain approach can be found here.

The latest update of the PLA introduces new content, an improved user experience and a completely new dashboard, making process harmonization easier and more actionable than ever. 

In this blog, you will get a high-level overview of:

  • The latest updates to Process Landscape Analysis and its new structure
  • The new Adherence to Target Processes dashboard and its key insights

 

The Process Landscape Analysis

First: what's new in the update?

The latest major PLA update delivers more and deeper content and new capabilities to track harmonization and ensure process adherence. The image below gives a clear overview of the current version and everything that will be added new. 

 

Understanding the Process Landscape Analysis 

What does this mean? To give a bit more context, let’s dive a bit more into the process landscape analysis and how it is built up. At its core, Process Landscape Analysis offers a consolidated view of the processes running in an ERP system by combining several modules of the SAP Signavio Suite. Built on three key components, it allows organizations to understand current process performance, identify process variants, and monitor adherence to target processes:

  • The Process House – Provides a top-down structure for navigating individual processes. It aggregates information at the end-to-end process level and company level, giving stakeholders a complete overview of process execution across the organization.
  • Individual Processes – Each process is analyzed for execution, variants, and transaction code usage. The Best-Run Score (BRS) evaluates process effectiveness and efficiency, helping identify high-volume processes that may need optimization.
  • Adherence to Target Processes Analysis – Compares actual execution with defined target process variants to monitor compliance, enforce standardization, and support the rollout of ERP templates.

Together, these three components create a comprehensive view of your ERP processes, laying the foundation for informed decisions and a successful transformation journey. The following video shows how it looks like. 

 

Adherence to Target Processes

A cornerstone of the update is the Adherence to Target Processes dashboard, which enables organizations to track harmonization and ensure process adherence in SAP transformation projects. The dashboard comes with the following analysis:

  • Current Process Variants Analysis – Provides a snapshot of process variants used across organizational units, highlighting inconsistencies and opportunities for standardization.
  • Comparison Against Target Processes – Measures adherence to defined templates, revealing deviations and guiding corrective actions, such as training or process refinement.
  • Assessment of Target Processes – Identifies rarely or never used variants, enabling deprecation and maintaining a lean ERP template.

For instance, if a rollout introduces a new procurement process, the dashboard shows which units follow the target process, where deviations occur, and which legacy variants may require retirement, ensuring operational efficiency and governance.

 

Challenge: Ensuring Consistent Execution Across Organizational Units

When customers define a template for their ERP system, they typically specify multiple process variants for each process. In each ERP system, customers are running many processes. This is called the ERP-Template. With Plug and Gain Process Landscape Analysis, customers can measure the actual process execution across more than 100 processes right out of the box.

However, the typical questions customers then ask: 

To which extent does our actual process execution match with the ERP template? Where do we need to reinforce the rollout?

And it’s not enough to see this at a global level. Typical customers have > 1,000 combinations of processes and organizational units. We need the transparency by process and organizational unit. That’s where the new adherence to target processes dashboard comes in! Within the dashboard customers are able to define specific target process variants for each process (their ERP template) and measure actual execution against that on the level of process and organizational unit. This helps understand how far away from the template the current execution is, if the role out was successful and exactly where it was not. 

 

Why Process Harmonization Matters

Process harmonization is essential for consistent, efficient, and compliant operations across an organization. It ensures that business processes are executed uniformly to reduce complexity, improve quality, and drive measurable business outcomes.
Successful harmonization strengthens both the top line (better customer experience, better financial results, faster execution) and the bottom line (cost reduction, standardization, and compliance). Yet, many organizations struggle to achieve this consistency, especially when multiple systems, tools, and organizational units are involved.

 

SAP Learning Journey available

In addition, we offer the following SAP Learning Journey, which provides a comprehensive guide to Process Landscape Analysis, including detailed explanations of each analysis, supporting video tutorials and how it could be applied in SAP Activate..

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Customer Payments – Transition and Future with APIs
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Customer Payments - Transition and Future with APIs

SAP has transitioned SAP Cloud for Customer Payments into maintenance mode and removed it from the price list (as of September 2, 2024). The solution will continue to be supported for existing customers under active contracts, but no further development or investments are made. Customers are encouraged to transition to the new API-based approach in SAP S/4HANA Cloud and On-Premise/Private Cloud.

Accounts receivable processes today are often costly, manual, and time-consuming. Many businesses face delays in cash collection, lack of transparency for their customers, and high operational costs for invoice and payment handling.

With the new S/4HANA APIs, SAP enables customers and partners to build modern customer-facing portals that accelerate the invoice-to-cash process and support automated cash collection. These portals empower end customers with self-service capabilities, reducing manual workload while improving the customer experience.

Capabilities Enabled by S/4HANA APIs

Using the APIs already available in S/4HANA On-Premise, Private Cloud, and Public Cloud businesses can:

APIs for Electronic Bill Presentment and Payment

  • Pay & manage bills: Select open items, create payments (via direct debit or credit card when SAP Digital Payments Add-on is integrated), view or cancel payments in process
  • Display account statements: View and download all items for a specific time period for the customer invoice, credit memo, and / or incoming payment(s)

Other APIs

  • Match payments with invoices: Improve reconciliation through payment matching
  • Create and manage payment advice: Issue or cancel payment advice efficiently
  • Make ad-hoc payments: Support payments on account or down payment requests
  • Manage account master data: View and update account and master data directly

These capabilities can be embedded into custom-built portals or integrated into existing customer-facing portals, offering flexibility for each company’s unique landscape.

This new API approach is not a one-to-one successor, but provides greater flexibility:

  • APIs are released for S/4HANA On-Premise, Private Cloud, and Public Cloud (from release 2508.02)
  • Customers can build their own portals, integrate into existing ones, or leverage partner-built portals
  • Partners are actively working with SAP to deliver ready-to-use solutions based on these APIs

Partner Solutions: Ready-to-Use Customer Payment Portals

To help customers accelerate adoption, SAP partners already offer pre-built customer payment and self-service portals leveraging the new APIs.

Kumulon – KUMOsphere B2B Payment Portal

Kumulon delivers a cloud-native, template-based portal built on SAP BTP with full support for SAP’s latest payment APIs.

  • Real cloud services, no legacy code – innovative SAP Cloud technologies only
  • Flexible templates – adapt quickly to customer needs while jumpstarting projects
  • Secure integration – SAP Cloud Connector ensures safe on-premise-to-cloud connectivity
  • Flexible deployment – operate in your own BTP environment or as SaaS on Kumulon’s BTP

🔗 KUMOsphere – B2B Payment Portal on SAP Store

Acuiti Labs – Customer Self Care and Payment Portal

Acuiti Labs offers a SaaS-based self-service and payment portal for S/4HANA Private and Public Cloud (Sales Billing/FI-AR) leveraging the S/4HANA APIs.

  • Customer self-service portal – empowers end customers to manage invoices and payments directly
  • Cross-solution experience – already proven in BRIM (FI-CA), Subscription Billing, and Q2C portals
  • Accelerated go-live – prebuilt solution reduces implementation effort

🔗 Acuiti Labs Customer Portal on SAP Store

Learn More

APIs for Electronic Billing and Presentment – S/4HANA On-Premise (OP), Private Cloud

  • All APIs part of the Electronic Billing and Presentment scope are shipped via SAP Note 3505741
  • For other required APIs outside the package, please see also the SAP Business Accelerator Hub for more details, for example: Managing Payment Advice is available, see Payment Advice (A2X).
  • For more information, visit the SAP Help Portal.

APIs for EBPP Payment Request – S/4HANA Public Cloud

  • Please see the SAP Business Accelerator Hub for the available EBPP Payment Request APIs.
  • For other required APIs outside the package, please see also the SAP Business Accelerator Hub for more details, for example:
    • Match payments with invoices & Create and manage payment advice, Payment Advice.
    • Make ad-hoc payments, Journal Entry -Post
    • Manage account master data, Business Partner
    • Customer account balance, Accounting Document - Read
  • For more information, visit the SAP Help Portal.

Summary

SAP Cloud for Customer Payments is moving into maintenance mode, and the future lies in API-driven, flexible customer payment portals. Customers can now:

  • Plan their transition to S/4HANA API-based solutions
  • Either build their own portals or leverage ready-to-use partner solutions from the SAP Store

This shift gives businesses greater flexibility, faster innovation, and improved customer experiences in the accounts receivable process.

entry.title: What's new for Production Planning in SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2025
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud has been officially released, and many new feature were delivered for production planning. From UI improvements to the MRP Cockpit Fiori apps to new Business Add-Ins available for MRP and production orders, this blog provides an overview of those new features that are available in the latest SAP S/4HANA release.

Improvements for MRP Cockpit Fiori Apps

Several improvements were delivered for the MRP Cockpit Fiori Apps Monitor Material Coverage - Net Segments (F0247A), Monitor Material Coverage - Net and Individual Segments (F2101A) and Manage Material Coverage (F0251A), bringing additional functionalities that util now were only available in the Stock/Requirements List, and also innovations that will mimic features originally available in the MRP List. 

Rescheduling and Cancelling of Proposals

Fiori Apps Monitor Material Coverage - Net Segments (F0247A) and Monitor Material Coverage - Net and Individual Segments (F2101A) were enhanced to display information about the number of rescheduling proposals that were generated for a specific material.

These apps will now display of the number of rescheduling proposals, and new filters were also introduced to allow users to filter for materials with specific rescheduling messages. The following figure shows the new fields and the new filters in the app Monitor Material Coverage.


Figure 1: Rescheduling Proposals in Monitor Material Coverage

Fiori app Manage Material Coverage has been also enhanced with new actions that will help users to resolve coverage issues and make sure requirements can be met as planned:

  • Proposals to reschedule MRP elements to an earlier date (reschedule in)
  • Proposals to reschedule MRP elements to a later date (reschedule out)
  • Proposals to cancel MRP elements (cancel process)

The following figure shows and example of the action Reschedule Out, for a purchase order with a rescheduling message:


Figure 2: Rescheduling actions in Manage Material Coverage

 

Last MRP Run

Fiori Apps Monitor Material Coverage and Manage Material Coverage were also enhanced to show the date of the last MRP Run, and to allow users to filter for material segments using the date of the Last MRP Run. The following figures show the filter and the field in Monitor Material Coverage and Manage Material Coverage.


Figure 3: Last MRP Run in Monitor Material Coverage

 

Figure 4: Last MRP Run in Manage Material Coverage

 

Planning Time Fence and Manual Firming Date

Another enhancement to the Monitor Material Coverage and Manage Material Coverage Fiori apps was the introduction of the Planning Time Fence and the possibility to set or change a Manual Time Fence.

New filters and columns for MRP type and planning time fence were added into the Material Coverage app, as we can see in the Figure below.


Figure 5: Planning Time Fence and MRP Type in Monitor Material Coverage

 

As we can see in Figure 6, Fiori App Manage Material Coverage now can show the Planning Time Fence, and users will also have the possibility to edit the Planning Time Fence.  

Figure 6: Planning Time Fence in Manage Material Coverage


Accept MRP Run Result

SAP S/4HANA 2025 also introduced a new feature called Accept the MRP results, allowing the planner to mark materials for which the MRP result has been already evaluated.

A new filter has been already introduced in Fiori App Monitor Material Coverage, so that the planner can filter for material segments where the MRP result has been already accepted or not, and there is also a new column called MRP Result Accepted, as we can see in Figure 7.

Figure 7: MRP Result Accepted in Fiori App Monitor Material Coverage

 

Fiori app Manage Material Coverage has also been enhanced with a button that allows the planner to Accept the MRP Results, or revoke the Acceptance of MRP results, as shown in Figure 8.  

Figure 8: Button Accept MRP Result in Fiori App Manage Material Coverage

 

This feature has been also introduced in both collect and individual access of the Stock/Requirements List (transactions MD04 and MD07), as I described in my blog Accept/Revoke MRP Run results in the Stock/Requirements List and MRP Fiori Apps, and it is available for earlier releases, as described in the blog. However, only as of SAP S/4HANA 2025 users will have the ability to mass Accept and Revoke the MRP Results from the Collective Access of the Stock/Requirements List, as shown in Figure 9.


Figure 9: Mass acceptance of MRP results in the Stock/Requirements List.

 

Downporting new features to SAP S/4HANA 2023

Some of the new features listed above can be also introduce in SAP S/4HANA 2023 with the implementation of the following notes:

No.

SAP Note

Description

1

3586336

SAP- Production Planning- Supporting Features- Rescheduling Proposals, Planning time fence and Last MRP Run.

2

3592002

SAP- Production Planning- Rescheduling Proposals, Planning time fence and Last MRP Run in Monitor material coverage- Net & Individual segments Fiori Application ( F2101A )

3

3592003

SAP- Production Planning- Rescheduling Proposals, Planning time fence and Last MRP Run in Monitor material coverage- Net segments ( F0247A )

4

3591572

SAP- Production Planning- Rescheduling Proposals, Planning time fence and Last MRP Run in Manage material coverage Fiori Application (F0251A)

 

MRP Live 

Technical improvements were also delivered for MRP Live in SAP S/4HANA 2025, including new BAdIs and the improvements in the integration of documents with PP/DS and IBP.

Business Transaction Events in MRP Live

SAP S/4HANA introduced a new feature in MRP Live, that allows the creation of business transaction events (BTEs) for business documents created within MRP Live (e.g. planned orders, purchase requisitions, scheduling agreements and stock transfer requisitions) enabling post-processing steps for other applications like PP/DS, IBP.

In previous releases, materials for which documents had to be integrated to PP/DS or IBP had to be planned by MRP Live in ABAP instead of HANA, because documents generated or changed by MRP were integrated by means of an RFC. With the new integration using BTE events, those materials can be planned in HANA, which an improved MRP Live performance.

For example, if we activate Advanced Planning for a material, and we choose the option PP/DS Display Only for the scope limitation, this material would be planned in ABAP by MRP Live. As of SAP S/4HANA 2025, we can use BTE events to integrate those documents, allowing the material to be planned in HANA.

The setting to activate the integration with BTE can be found in transaction PPHMRPSET, as we can see in Figure 10.


Figure 10: Setting to activate Business Transaction Events in MRP Live.

New BAdIs for MRP

  • Adjustment of Planned Order Component Data during BOM Explosion (PPH_PLDORD_COMP_ADJ):  This new BAdI allows you to modify the storage location and production supply area of components in planned orders during BOM explosion in the following processes:

    • Planning run of material requirements planning and master production scheduling

    • Manual planned order creation
    • Backflush for repetitive manufacturing without planned order

  • Additional Parameters for Navigation Profile (MD_NAVIGATION_ADJUST😞 With this new BAdI you can change the parameter IDs for transactions which are maintained in Customizing activity Define Navigation Profiles. Navigation profiles enable you to navigate faster and more flexibly between transactions, and with the new BAdI you can use more than only three parameter IDs.

 

Shop-Floor Control

Besides the already mentioned improvements for MRP, SAP S/4HANA 2025 also brought improvements for Shop-Floor Control, including a better handling for partial consumption posted from EWM, and new technical objects, like RAP Business Objects and Data Products. 

 

Partial Consumption and Split for Error Handling for Automatic Goods Movement, COGI

SAP S/4HANA 2025 also introduced a new feature that enables partial retrograde goods issue for non-batched and non-serialized components in embedded SAP Extended Warehouse Management, checking availability in the bin of the production supply area during the manufacturing process

This feature allows postprocessing of error records from automatic goods movements (COGI transaction) only for unavailable quantities of components, and it works for discrete and repetitive manufacturing. It will enable as-is partial goods movement between SAP EWM and production during synchronous goods movement processes, increasing PSA stock control, reducing clerical work, and improving accuracy of stock data. Figure 11 shows the setting use to activate this new feature in the Production Scheduling Profile.


Figure 11: Goods Issue Quantity Split setting in the Production Scheduling Profile

 

Example:

  • 3 EA of component KOMPK1-01 are available in the bin in production supply area, as shown in Figure 12.


Figure 12: 3 EA of component available in the Supply Area.

 

  • Figure 13 shows that the backflush of the component for a production order requires 12 EA,


Figure 13: Backflush requires 12 EA of the component.

 

  • When we post the backflush for the production order, 3 EA of component KOMPK1-01 are issued, as shown in Figure 14.


Figure 14: Backflush was posted and the consumption of 3 EA has been posted.

 

  • As we have activated the Goods Issue Quantity Split in the Production Scheduling Profile, the remaining quantity of 9 EA went into Postprocessing of Error Records from Automatic Goods Movements (transaction COGI), as shown in Figure 15.

 


Figure 15: Postprocessing of the remaining quantity in COGI

 

BAdI for Initialization of Order Component on Creation

With the new Business Add-In (BAdI), Order Component - Initialization on Creation (PPH_PRODORD_COMP_ADJ) you can fill the material planning relevance and the bulk indicator at the order component (reservation) level when creating an order.

 

RAP Business Objects for Production Orders

SAP S/4HANA 2025 also brought new technical objects that will help customers to make sure that custom developments are clean core compatible. New RAP Business Objects were introduced for Production Orders, Process Orders and Routings, enabling cloud-native APIs for SAP BusinessObjects in production execution and on-stack extensibility for Manufacturing.



Figure 16: New Production and Process Order RAP BOs 

 

Manufacturing Data Products

A SAP data product is a pre-packaged dataset that is ready for consumption by applications for analytics, AI, and other business intelligence purposes. A comprehensive set of ERP data products sourced from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition is now available, providing structured insights into manufacturing execution:

  • Production version
  • Work center
  • Manufacturing codes
  • Production confirmation
  • Production order
  • Enterprise resource capacity
  • Production routing]

SAP API Hub provides more information about the Manufacturing Data Products.

 

See also:

Planning Time Fence and Last MRP Run

Accept Planning Result of MRP Run

Rescheduling Proposals for MRP Elements

Business Transaction Events in MRP Live

BAdI for Adjustment of Planned Order Component Data during BOM Explosion

BAdI for Allowing Additional Parameters for Navigation Profile

BAdI for Initialization of Order Component on Creation

Partial Goods Issue for Component Consumption in Manufacturing

API Hub

 

Brought to you by the SAP S/4HANA Regional Implementation Group

entry.title: Last Call for Registration: SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Cycle 3-2025 📢
entry.content:
The third cycle of the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative for 2025 is still live, featuring 47 new projects offering early insights into SAP's product developments. This is your final chance to register for these projects to work with SAP teams and shape the future of SAP solutions.

🕛Time is Running Out: Registration Closes November 14, 2025

In the dynamic business landscape, early involvement can make a significant impact. Engage directly with SAP product managers and developers, share your feedback, and influence product development from the start.

Explore the available projects from our detailed list here, or follow the links below to discover exciting opportunities:

SAP Ariba

  • Asset Administration Shell (AAS) with SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration

SAP Business Technology Platform

  • Adoption of the SAP Job Scheduling service and it's new capabilities
  • AI-assisted message monitoring agent for SAP Integration Suite
  • Attachment handling made easy with SAP Document Management service CAP Plugin
  • CAP Apps and SAP BTP Kyma Runtime Environment
  • Effortlessly manage you documents using SAP Document Management service mobile application
  • Improving the Admin's and Solution Architect's Experience on SAP BTP
  • SAP Discovery Center: Long-Term User Research Initiative
  • Shape the future of job orchestration capabilities in SAP Build Process Automation
  • The impact of AI on SAP BTP users

SAP Concur

  • Concur Travel Allowance: Share Your Experiences
  • Discovery for App Center Enhancement

Customer Experience

  • Agentic Innovation in SAP Sales Cloud
  • CX Intelligent Application

Data & Analytics

  • AI- Assisted Summaries in SAP Analytics Cloud Stories
  • Personalized KPI Monitoring Workflow
  • SAP HANA Database Migration to SAP HANA Cloud (XSC,XSA,CAP)

SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Finance & Risk

  • Risk Management Lifecycle for SAP Risk and Assurance Management

Digital Supply Chain Cloud

  • Identify un-assessed assets and auto propose draft risk assessments using AI Agent
  • SAP Digital Battery Passport
  • SAP Field Service Management - Improvements for Maintenance Planning

Private Cloud

  • Compatible Unit Transformation: Modernizing Compatible Unit Management
  • SAP Responsibility Management in ERP Private Cloud and On-Premise
  • Supply and Demand Segmentation: improvements of functionality and integration

Public Cloud

  • A Modern Treasury Experience: New Fiori App for Interest Rate Instrument
  • AI Agent for Accrual Postings SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • AI Agent for Debt Collection
  • AI Assistant for Manual Postings in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Business AI for Product Cost Controlling
  • Joule as Project Assistant: Optimizing Project Execution and Reducing Manual Processes
  • Let’s Create the Future of US Sales and Use Tax with AI
  • Line Item Settlement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Manage Statistical Key Figure Values: Potential Enhancements
  • Modernizing Inventory valuation - Lower of Cost or Net Realizable Value
  • Parallel Unit of Measure
  • Review Booklets and MDA: the next level of SAP S/4HANA Reporting and Analytics
  • SAP Responsibility Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • SAP Risk and Assurance Management - Enhance the Task Management user experience
  • SAP Risk and Assurance Management - Exploring Joule use cases and AI features
  • User Interface Masking for Process Industries in SAP Cloud ERP
  • SAP Fiori Elements for Mobile

SAP Globalization

  • Regulatory Change Manager: Solution to help navigate Regulatory Changes with ease
  • Reimagine VAT Reporting Solution for Ukraine Based on SAP Document and Reporting Compliance

Lifecycle Management

  • Automation and AI in Private Cloud Workspace
  • Clean Core / RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard in SAP Cloud ALM
  • Explore modifiable transport requests on SAP BTP

Other

  • SAP S/4HANA for Fashion and Vertical Business: Supply Chain Collaboration

Let’s shape the future together!

Innovation happens through collaboration. By participating in the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative projects, you help SAP create better, more relevant solutions for businesses like yours. This is your chance to influence what comes next.

Don’t miss out - sign up today at influence.sap.com and be a part of the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Cycle 3 in 2025!

Warm regards, 
Your SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Team 

Follow-up after registration: When you register for a project, you will be invited to an introductory call with the SAP project lead. Participation beyond this point is optional and typically governed by the Feedback Agreement with SAP.

entry.title: SAP Central Finance in SAP Sovereign Cloud and SAP NS2
entry.content:
SAP Central Finance in SAP Sovereign Cloud and SAP NS2

We are excited to announce that SAP Central Finance, Private Edition is now generally available in SAP Sovereign Cloud and in SAP National Security Services (NS2).

This new deployment option unlocks the capabilities and benefits of SAP Central Finance for customers with highest security and compliance requirements who cannot use the standard private cloud environment. This is important in particular for customers operating in specific industries, like defense & security, public sector or regulated industries.

 

What is SAP Sovereign Cloud in a nutshell?

SAP Sovereign Cloud

  • is designed to help organizations adopt cloud technologies while maintaining full control over their data, infrastructure, and compliance
  • goes beyond basic digital sovereignty to meet advanced compliance requirements across four key dimensions: data, operational, technical and legal sovereignty
  • is available in selected countries and offers tailored solutions aligned with local regulatory standards

 

What is Central Finance in a nutshell?

Central Finance is a solution which builds bridges between systems and helps companies in their business transformation. With Central Finance you can connect SAP and Non-SAP systems to an SAP S/4HANA Central Finance system and leverage a harmonized financial reporting across legal entities or enable a centralized financial processing (e.g. shared services for Finance). Central Finance helps companies to move into the cloud, to adopt latest innovation of S/4HANA Cloud including Business AI for Finance, and to transform step by step to an agile company with self-defined pace.

For more information on Central Finance, please explore SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Central Finance.

 

What is the release status and scope of Central Finance in SAP Sovereign Cloud and SAP NS2?

SAP Central Finance is successfully validated and certified on SAP Sovereign Cloud and SAP NS2. This validation includes full technical and security validation. First customers are already live with Central Finance in the NS2 environment.

The Sovereign Cloud release of SAP Central Finance, Private Edition is currently available in following countries:

  • Australia / New Zealand
  • Canada
  • United Kingdom
  • United States (NS2)

 Please note that Sovereign Cloud is available on different infrastructures in those regions, e.g. hyperscalers like AWS or Azure.  

 Below please find an overview which CFIN relevant products are released in the Sovereign Cloud in selected regions:

Product

Status

SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Central Finance Foundation, Private Edition

Available

SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Central Finance Foundation, Private Edition, Tailored Option

On Request

SAP Landscape Transformation Replication Server for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

Available

SAP Central Finance Master Data Replication by insightsoftware, Priv Ed, Tailored Option

On Request

SAP Central Finance Transaction Replication by insightsoftware, Priv Ed, Tailored Option

On Request

 The offering in Sovereign Cloud keeps growing: We are continuously expanding our footprint into new countries and regions, enriching our solution portfolio, and enhancing our services. Expect regular updates, as there is an exciting roadmap ahead.

 

How could the Central Finance architecture look like in SAP Sovereign Cloud and SAP NS2?

Every customer landscape is unique and that is also valid for the Central Finance architecture. There can be variances in each and every deployment, but there are roughly two deployment options to be considered, depending on the existing customer landscape:

 Option 1 (standard option)

 

Option 2*

*e.g. for customers who are already using a stand-alone SLT server

 

The offering in SAP Sovereign Cloud and SAP NS2 continues to be extended – so please stay tuned! 🔊

entry.title: Extensibility in Supply Protection
entry.content:
Supply protection operates on some fundamental principles. A demand can match a time bucket, but it can't match different buckets within one protection group. Another core principle is that a matching demand only consumes the protection of the time bucket it matches. If there's no remaining protection for this bucket, the consumption is still recorded for this time bucket. In this case, the remaining protection is zero, not negative. 

Sometimes, customers prefer more flexibility. 

An alternative could be to shift consumption to a time bucket with remaining protection. If the protection of a time bucket is fully consumed, a matching demand should first consume protection of the previous or next time bucket instead of exceeding the protection of the current bucket. 

Another, more specific alternative could be a change for the privileged check quantity if supply protection is set to Restriction outside planned protection. With this setting, a demand has low restriction if protection is remaining for the matching time bucket. If there is no protection remaining, the restriction is quite high.  

Some customers like to be even more flexible. For example, they might want to use the quantity from the next time bucket, the aggregation of all time buckets in the group, or just a defined quantity as the privileged check quantity, instead of the quantity of a single time bucket.  

All these use cases are supported with the help of the available Business Add-Ins (BAdIs). 

  • BAdI: ATP Supply Protection - Redistribution of Consumption (OP 2023 FPS0) 
    (ATP_SUP_REDISTRIBUTE_CNSMPN) 
  • BAdI: ATP Supply Protection – Removal of Restriction Groups (OP2023 FPS0) 
    (ATP_SUP_REMOVAL_RSTRCN_GROUPS) 
  • BAdI: ATP Supply Protection - Remove Restriction Groups Inside Privileged Check Quantity (OP2023 FPS2) 
    (ATP_SUP_RMVL_RSTR_GRPS_U2P_IN) 
  • BAdI: ATP Supply Protection - Remove Restriction Groups Outside Privileged Check Quantity (OP2023 FPS2) 
    (ATP_SUP_RMVL_RSTR_GRPS_U2P_OUT) 
  • BAdI: ATP Supply Protection - Change of Remaining Protection of Matching Groups (OP2023 FPS2) 
    (ATP_SUP_CHANGE_GRPS_RMNG_PROT) 

Let’s take a look at the options the different BAdIs provide: 

Redistribution of Consumption (ATP_SUP_REDISTRIBUTE_CNSMPN) 

By default, the consumption of protection is assigned only to the matching time bucket and reduces the remaining protection. With the help of the BAdI to redistribute the consumption, it is also possible to write consumptions in other time buckets of the matching protection group. 

One use case is to only write consumptions in the matching time bucket if there is still a remaining protection. If all the protection is consumed, the next consumption should be assigned to another time bucket like the previous or the next time bucket. 


Illustration: Matching Sales Order


Illustration: Distribution of protection across different time buckets with BAdI ATP_SUP_REDISTRIBUTE_CNSMPN 

Removal of Restriction Groups (ATP_SUP_REMOVAL_RSTRCN_GROUPS) 

Higher or equally prioritized protection groups of the matching supply protection object are treated as restriction. Here, the BAdI “Removal of Restriction Groups” can change the restrictions. It’s possible to ignore any other protection group of the matching supply protection object. With this a matching demand is less restricted and the likelihood of getting a confirmation for a request increases. 

For sure, the reliability of the protection in total is reduced if the restriction is not that strict. 

Illustration: Removal of Restrictions

Remove Restriction Groups Inside Privileged Check Quantity (ATP_SUP_RMVL_RSTR_GRPS_U2P_IN) 

The restriction type “Restriction outside planned protection” is a bit more complex as there are potentially two different checks for the availability. If you are not familiar with the restriction type “Restriction outside planned protection” you should read the related community blog. 
One of the principles is as follows: If the requested quantity is below the remaining protection of the matching time bucket, the restriction is low. For requested quantities which exceed the remaining protection of the matching time bucket the restriction is high. 

Illustration: Removal of Restrictions ”Inside Privileged Check Quantity”

In the illustration, parallel restrictions with the same priority also exist. Equal and higher prioritized protections are considered as restrictions for the check “inside the privileged check quantity”. With the BAdI ATP_SUP_RMVL_RSTR_GRPS_U2P_IN it is possible to remove these restrictions. 

Remove Restriction Groups Outside Privileged Check Quantity (ATP_SUP_RMVL_RSTR_GRPS_U2P_OUT) 

For demands exceeding the remaining protection of the matching time bucket, the restriction might be high, as also lower prioritized protections are considered as restriction. This is a basic principle of the restriction type “Restriction outside planned protection”. However, for this kind of restrictions a BAdI exists to remove protection groups. If there are many vertical protection groups, it might be interesting to not be restricted by all the groups of lower priority, but just by the groups which are one or two levels below. 

Using the BAdIs to remove restrictions is something every customer should think about very carefully.
Although the following setting is possible, it might not always be reasonable. So, it would be wrong to have a demand facing a lower restriction if it is already outside of the own protection compared to the restrictions of the first check within the own protection. 


Illustration: Removal of Restrictions ”Outside Privileged Check Quantity” 

Change of Remaining Protection of Matching Groups 
(ATP_SUP_CHANGE_GRPS_RMNG_PROT) 

With the BAdI “Change of Remaining Protection of Matching Groups” it is possible to change the quantity we also sometimes call the “Inplan-Quantity” or the “privileged Quantity”. This is the quantity which is checked for the first check for the restriction type “Restriction outside planned Protection”. Sometime customers want to have more flexibility here as well. One simple use case is as follows ... 
If there are monthly time buckets the remaining protection might be quite low at the end of the month as the protection is already consumed. If the request matched the next time bucket, the confirmed quantities would be higher again. Therefore, some customers want to consider the protected quantities of the following or previous time bucket as an additional quantity for the first check. In this case they also want to redistribute the consumption afterwards again, so that consumptions exceeding the own planned protections are only stored at a time bucket, if the remaining protection of the surrounding time buckets is already expired.  


Illustration: With the BAdI ATP_SUP_CHANGE_GRPS_RMNG_PROT quantities of additional time buckets are considered as ”Privileged Check Quantity”

There are different options to change the logic of Supply Protection and customer can use the application more flexible. However, every change of the logic in standard has an impact, and the BAdIs should be used very carefully. 

Links 

SAP Help: App Extensibility: Manage Supply Protection (Key User)

entry.title: Unlock What’s New: 2025 SAP Cloud ERP Private Release Deep Dive Series
entry.content:
Unlock What’s New: 2025 SAP Cloud ERP Private Release Deep Dive Series

The 2025 release of SAP Cloud ERP Private brings powerful innovations across every line of business with an AI-First, Suite-First strategy by integrating applications, data, and AI — from a strengthened core to embedded AI and intelligent agents that transform how work gets done.

Your customers can join us December 8-11 in our exclusive deep-dive webinar series to discover how these new features provide tangible innovation impact across your key lines of business: 

  • Monday 8th Dec 4-5pm CET - Procurement & Sales 
  • Tuesday 9th Dec 4-5pm CET - Asset & Service Management
  • Wednesday 10th Dec 4-5pm CET - Finance
  • Thursday 11th Dec 4-5pm CET - Manufacturing, R&D and Supply Chain

Why should your customer attend?

Core Highlights:

  • Embedded AI: AI is integrated across key processes in your LoBs bringing precision and predictability to every decision.
  • Role-Aware Assistant: Joule is evolving into a role-aware assistant, tailoring insights and actions to each user’s responsibilities.
  • AI-Ready Data: Help businesses manage, analyze, and leverage their data with over 130 pre-delivered data products, accelerating decision-making.

LoB Highlights:

  • Finance: Achieve real-time profitability insight using universal parallel accounting and improve your cashflow with receivables and payables financing integrated with SAP Taulia. Improve liquidity with specialized agents like the Accounts Receivable Agent and shorten resolution cycle with the Dispute Management Agent.
  • Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Ensure faster, more reliable order fulfillment using the enhanced advanced available-to-promise (ATP) capability. Optimize warehouse operations with AI-assisted predictive labor demand planning.
  • Asset and Service: Improve equipment reliability and reduce downtime. The Maintenance Planner Agent recommends maintenance events and coordinates schedules based on interconnected data.
  • Procurement: Use Joule to simplify the creation of self-service purchase requisition and benefit from migration reports to transition to Lean Services.
  • Sales: Streamlines sales operations with AI-assisted sales order fulfillment and solution quotation creation. Explore how enhanced sales order and returns order management increase efficiency.

How to invite your Customers

  • Link to further topic Information - coming soon
  • Email Invitation - use this email template to send to your customers inviting them to the session
  • Direct Registration Link


For further questions, reach out to Architha Aravindakshan.
